item.title: Proposed changes to the tenure of independent board directors in Singapore
item.description: The Singapore Exchange Regulation (SGX RegCo) is asking for public opinion on its suggestion to implement a strict nine-year limit for independent board directors (IDs) and end the two-tier voting system for long-serving IDs. The consultation document states that if directors wish to stay on after the limit, they must be reclassified as non-independent, even if their appointment was previously approved by a two-tier vote. They are also seeking feedback on making it mandatory for companies to disclose the exact amount and breakdown of board directors’ and the CEO’s pay in their annual report, identifying them by name.
